intro: Moraea fragrans, commonly known as the sweet-scented moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its fragrant blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Moraea fragrans is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its elegant appearance and pleasant aroma.
